title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
description: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

items.content_html:
There are CSRF vulnerabilities in Subrion CMS 4.1.x through 4.1.5, and before 4.2.0, because of a logic error. Although there is functionality to detect CSRF, it is called too late in the ia.core.php code, allowing (for example) an attack against the query parameter to panel/database.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-15063
  • https://github.com/intelliants/subrion/issues/547
  • https://github.com/intelliants/subrion/issues/570
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-rc94-7v55-wmg6
items.title: [intelliants/subrion] Subrion CMS CSRF Vulnerability

items.content_html:
Subrion CMS 4.1.5 has CSRF in blog/delete/.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-18366
  • https://github.com/intelliants/subrion/issues/477
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-c939-g732-48r8
items.title: [intelliants/subrion] Subrion CMS CSRF Vulnerability

items.content_html:
phpMyAdmin 4.0, 4.4, and 4.6 are vulnerable to a CSS injection attack through crafted cookie parameters

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-1000015
  • https://www.phpmyadmin.net/security/PMASA-2017-4
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210123220229/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/95726
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3fgq-cmr4-97rr
items.title: [phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin] phpMyAdmin CSS Injection Vulnerability

phpMyAdmin 4.0, 4.4, and 4.6 are vulnerable to an open redirect weakness

items.title: [phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin] phpMyAdmin Open Redirect

items.content_html:
An issue was discovered in Symfony before 2.7.38, 2.8.31, 3.2.14, 3.3.13, 3.4-BETA5, and 4.0-BETA5. The Intl component includes various bundle readers that are used to read resource bundles from the local filesystem. The read() methods of these classes use a path and a locale to determine the language bundle to retrieve. The locale argument value is commonly retrieved from untrusted user input (like a URL parameter). An attacker can use this argument to navigate to arbitrary directories via the dot-dot-slash attack, aka Directory Traversal.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-16654
  • https://github.com/symfony/symfony/pull/24994
  • https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/03/msg00009.html
  • https://symfony.com/blog/cve-2017-16654-intl-bundle-readers-breaking-out-of-paths
  • https://www.debian.org/security/2018/dsa-4262
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-c49r-8gj6-768r
items.title: [symfony/symfony] Symfony Directory Traversal

items.content_html:
An issue was discovered in Symfony 2.7.x before 2.7.38, 2.8.x before 2.8.31, 3.2.x before 3.2.14, and 3.3.x before 3.3.13. DefaultAuthenticationSuccessHandler or DefaultAuthenticationFailureHandler takes the content of the _target_path parameter and generates a redirect response, but no check is performed on the path, which could be an absolute URL to an external domain. This Open redirect vulnerability can be exploited for example to mount effective phishing attacks.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-16652
  • https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/03/msg00009.html
  • https://symfony.com/blog/cve-2017-16652-open-redirect-vulnerability-on-security-handlers
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-r7p7-qr7p-2rrf
items.title: [symfony/symfony] Symfony Open Redirect

items.content_html:
Subrion CMS 4.0.5 has CSRF in admin/blocks/add/. The attacker can create any block, and can optionally insert XSS via the content parameter.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-6068
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210126223835/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/97091
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-q4h5-g3w8-f9x7
items.title: [intelliants/subrion] Subrion CMS CSRF Vulnerability

items.content_html:
phpMyAdmin 4.0, 4.4., and 4.6 are vulnerable to a DOS attack in the replication status by using a specially crafted table name

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-1000018
  • https://www.phpmyadmin.net/security/PMASA-2017-7
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210123220317/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/95738
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-47qr-f86f-3wm4
items.title: [phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin] phpMyAdmin DoS Vulnerability

items.content_html:
In Moodle 3.x, course creators are able to change system default settings for courses.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-7532
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=355556
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/6e861be6b7d49c5ac4583ae46762a28ede5785ad
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/915f801546a5c3618feab897072c985abfce57df
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210614032706/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99617
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jjhx-5jff-rc8m
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle Improper Privilege Management
